items.title: Nifty, Sensex Touch 52-Week Highs: What should investors do now?
items.summary: The Nifty and Sensex touched their 52-week highs in today’s session, reflecting strong market sentiment and broad-based buying across sectors. With benchmark indices back at levels last seen over a year ago, investors are now wondering whether this is the right time to stay invested, book partial profits, or wait for a correction.

items.title: Jeh Aerospace leases 2 lakh sq ft at Blackstone-backed Horizon Industrial Park for new manufacturing unit
items.summary: Jeh Aerospace is building a new advanced manufacturing facility in Hyderabad. This 2 Lakh sq ft facility will be operational in 2026. It will be a software-defined, AI-enabled production unit. The expansion strengthens Jeh's technology-led production capabilities. This move supports global demand for precision aerospace components.

items.title: Oath-Taking Ceremony: What it means? What makes Nitish Kumar’s swearing-in special?
items.summary: An oath-taking ceremony is an official proceeding in which a public leader officially steps into their role by taking an oath. This oath is a word of honour given in front of citizens as a commitment to respect the Constitution and uphold duties with honesty and dedication.

items.title: Railways is a strategic sector; cannot be handed to private players: Former Railway Board Member at CRF Conclave
items.summary: Debates around railway privatisation date back decades, from committee reports recommending restructuring to proposals for private trains. However, concerns around national security, affordability, social obligations, and the scale of operations have consistently stalled full privatisation, with governments instead favouring controlled private participation in select segments.

items.title: Euro zone yields edge up as Nvidia emboldens investors; long-dated bonds wilt
items.summary: The European Central Bank, in contrast, is not expected to move rates at all in the coming year, based on the swaps market

items.title: TCA Anant: A viral customs spat shows the confusion caused by an outdated product classification system
items.summary: Online outrage over a ‘misdeclared’ massager may have seemed like another case of Indian red tape, but the real story lies in a creaky global codebook that can’t keep pace with modern products. Don’t blame officialdom for grey zones in the Harmonized System. It badly needs to be revised.

items.title: GE Aerospace to invest $14 million in its Pune manufacturing facility
items.summary: New investment aims to strengthen the site’s capabilities through upgraded manufacturing processes and automation, including enhancements that support advanced engine components

items.title: India’s railway overhaul is minting new winners—here are 3 smallcaps to watch
items.summary: Government capex, electrification, and safety upgrades are creating fresh opportunities for smallcap players across the railway ecosystem. Here are three stocks positioned to benefit.

items.title: Nifty may surge to 27,500 over next few months: Rahul Sharma
items.summary: Indian markets are showing optimism, with Nifty poised for a breakout above 26,100. Hopes of a US trade deal and improving investor sentiment are driving this, potentially pushing Nifty towards 26,500. Experts suggest buying on dips, favoring largecaps and US-exposed stocks. A Santa rally is also possible, with Nifty potentially reaching 27,500 by year-end.

items.title: Rs 53,700 crore loss: Nuvama expects oil companies to get LPG subsidy
items.summary: Oil marketing companies are burdened with Rs 53,700 crore in LPG under-recoveries and the government may release Rs 30,000 crore in subsidies in 12 tranches from November 2025, according to a Nuvama Research report. The brokerage warns the subsidy covers only 56% of losses as rising prices, high capex and sector uncertainty deepen the strain.

items.title: Not just Groww, another newly-listed broking stock trades 79% above listing price — Do you hold it?
items.summary: Anand Rathi Share and Stock Brokers also saw impressive gains, reflecting optimism in the Indian stock market's retail investor participation. The shares, which entered the secondary market on September 30, are now trading 79% higher than their IPO price of  ₹414.

items.title: Expert view: Selective value emerging in high-quality IT names, says JM Financial's senior fund manager
items.summary: Expert view: Asit Bhandarkar from JM Financial highlights the gradual recovery of the IT sector amidst stabilising valuations and strong corporate earnings. With cautious optimism, he emphasises a balanced investment approach focusing on quality and domestic sectors to navigate market volatility.&nbsp;

items.title: Metals & Mining Shares: From Tata Steel to Coal India — HSBC lists stocks to buy, hold or reduce
items.summary: Metals Stocks To Buy: The BSE Metal index traded almost flat during the session, supported by mild gains in stocks like Hindalco, NALCO, JSW Steel and Jindal Steel, while counters such as SAIL, NMDC and Welspun Corp came under pressure.

items.title: EV demand, rise of infra to boost adoption of metal cold-roll forming
items.summary: Construction equipment, elevator systems and industrial machinery manufacturers are also expanding the use of roll-formed profiles for machine frames, elevators, mezzanines and warehouse structures to enable faster assembly and standardised deployment. The scope of sheet-metal cold-roll-forming precision components would continue to grow, given that the country added 12.4 GW of new solar capacity during the April-September period of the current fiscal year.

items.title: Nvidia Effect: This smallcap multibagger stock soars 6% after strong earnings from tech giant
items.summary: Netweb Technologies shares: The stock jumped after Nvidia’s strong Q4 results boosted sentiment. The stock surged because Netweb has a deep partnership with Nvidia to build high-end computing systems, including Blackwell-powered AI servers.

items.title: Sensex hits new high, Nifty above 26,200 level; Reliance, Eicher Motors, Bajaj Finserv lead gainers
items.summary: Positive global cues and fresh fund inflows boost sentiment, pushing Nifty 50 to scale above the 26,200-level for the first time since September 2024

items.title: How stock lending can help you earn passive income
items.summary: Do you know about the Stock Lending and Borrowing Mechanism (SLBM)? It’s a vital market feature that allows investors to temporarily lend or borrow securities. Here’s everything you should know about how it works and why it matters.

items.title: Tata Technologies share price: What went wrong with Tata group stock after dream debut on Dalal Street?
items.summary: According to market analysts, Tata Technologies’ sharp fall from a blockbuster IPO listing to more than 50% below its peak comes from a mix of sector, operational, and sentiment driven issues.

items.title: Trump does it again! US president boasts about mediating Indo-Pak conflict, says 'didn’t want nuclear dust over LA'
items.summary: New Delhi has time and again denied any foreign mediation on bilateral issues. Despite this,  US President Donald Trump continues to reiterate his version, claiming he “saved millions of lives” by stepping in and threatening both nations with unprecedented tariffs.

items.title: Nifty, Sensex hover near record levels amid broad market strength at mid-session
items.summary: Nifty gains 118.95 points or 0.46 per cent to 26,171.60, climbing past its earlier record of 26,104.20. The 50-share index opened at 26,132.10 compared to Wednesday’s close of 26,052.65.

items.title: NCLT approves SeQuent Scientific, Viyash Lifesciences merger
items.summary: Rajaram Narayanan, Managing Director and CEO, SeQuent, said, “There are significant opportunities to provide relevant, differentiated and quality care for animals”

items.title: Investors should stay selective as IT, banking show mixed signals: Sandip Sabharwal
items.summary: Indian IT stocks are seeing a rally but may offer modest returns. Banks, especially large private and PSU banks, are expected to perform well. NBFCs remain a solid investment choice. Investors should be selective. AI's impact on India will take time to materialize. Data centers are capital intensive with unclear returns. Top-tier NBFCs are recommended for safety.

items.title: Can Pine Labs shares tank over 10%? Emkay sets target below IPO price, gives 'reduce' tag
items.summary: Pine Labs share price fell as much as 2.8% to a day’s low of  ₹235.30 today, while Emkay Global’s target implies a 13% decline from the stock’s last close of  ₹242.10.

items.title: Chipmaker small-cap stock MIC Electronics jumps 10%; do you own?
items.summary: MIC Electronics share price has fallen 13% in one month, and has declined 3% in three months. The smallcap stock has dropped 19% in six months and has plunged 45% in one year. MIC Electronics shares have gained 30% in two years and have delivered multibagger returns of 5,200% in the past five years.

items.title: Nvidia’s strong results lift markets; are fears of an AI bubble overblown?
items.summary: Nvidia's impressive earnings report has sparked debate about the AI sector's growth potential versus bubble risks. While some experts warn of overheated valuations, others argue that the long-term outlook for AI remains strong.&nbsp;

items.title: Automation hits India’s tech hiring, and staffing giants are feeling the chill
items.summary: GCCs are hiring fewer people as automation scales and IT demand weakens, squeezing revenues at India’s largest staffing firms even as specialized roles and AI-led centres see traction.

items.title: India–Australia CECA talks near conclusion as trade ties deepen: Jaishankar
items.summary: Jaishankar, Australian Minister Wong discuss cooperation in cyber tech, trade, maritime security, defence, sport

items.title: Indian businesses gain greater market access through Abu Dhabi: Abu Dhabi Global Market Chairman
items.summary: Indian companies are increasing their presence in Abu Dhabi, which offers them access to markets across the Middle East, Africa, and beyond. Abu Dhabi's economic growth and supportive business environment are attracting Indian entrepreneurs and investors.

items.title: PSB Xchange prepares for 2026 launch with Rs 3 lakh crore loan ambition
items.summary: A new digital platform from the PSB alliance goes live in January 2026. This platform will offer small businesses a streamlined way to get credit. Fintechs and organizations working with MSMEs can connect directly.

items.title: Options traders expect Nifty to hit a new high by Tuesday
items.summary: Traders have been selling a combination of Nifty call and put options, expiring on Tuesday, at the 26,100 strike for a combined  ₹258 a share. With this trade, sellers will pocket the entire  ₹258 if the Nifty stays within 25,842-26,358 by contract expiry.

items.title: US tariffs pinch margins of Indian solar PV module manufacturers
items.summary: Indian solar PV module manufacturers will have to deepen engagement with Europe, Middle East and Africa

items.title: Japan's Nikkei snaps 4-day loss as Nvidia outlook boosts tech sector
items.summary: The Nikkei 225 Index briefly climbed above the key psychological 50,000 figure before losing some momentum in the afternoon. The gauge closed up 2.7% at 49,823.94, while the broader Topix gained 1.7%.

items.title: Narayana Hrudayalaya’s stock price spurt: What's at the heart of the matter?
items.summary: Narayana Hrudayalaya Ltd's stock has risen 57% in 2025, driven by strong quarterly results. The company is the fourth-largest hospital stock, with significant overseas revenue. However, valuation concerns and operational challenges in the Cayman Islands may impact future gains.

items.title: Nvidia’s AI surge masks underlying market risks: Trip Chowdhry
items.summary: Nvidia's strong earnings are noted. However, an analyst suggests the stock's euphoria may be short-lived. He also believes India's AI data centre hopes might be misplaced. The analyst points to proprietary chips from companies like Google. He states that foundational AI models are primarily developed in the US and China.

items.title: Axis Bank share price hits record high as UBS upgrades lender. Do technicals support bullish outlook?
items.summary: Axis Bank share price rose to a record high in trade today as UBS upgraded its rating to ‘Buy’ and raised the target price to  ₹1500, citing improving credit costs and asset quality.&nbsp;

items.title: ITC voluntarily delists from Calcutta Stock Exchange
items.summary: The Calcutta Stock Exchange has granted its approval for voluntary delisting of the ordinary shares of ITC from its “official list of exchange” with effect from November 20, 2025, said ITC in a regulatory filing

items.title: AI Is Hurting Your Next PC Upgrade As RAM Prices Skyrocket 3x In Three Months
items.summary: The manufacturing lines that used to churn out consumer DRAMs are now busy making memory for data centres.

items.title: Mansion House maker toasts a premium whisky move with launch of Seven Islands Pure Malt
items.summary: Tilaknagar Industries, India's largest brandy maker, has entered the premium whisky market. They launched Seven Islands Pure Malt Whisky, an Indo-Scottish blend. This move signifies a major expansion for the company. The new whisky is priced at ₹5,200 for 750 ml and is available in Maharashtra. This launch positions whisky as a key growth area for Tilaknagar Industries.

items.title: ITC voluntary delists from Calcutta Stock Exchange
items.summary: Diversified conglomerate ITC has successfully completed the voluntary delisting of its shares from the Calcutta Stock Exchange (CSE), effective November 20, 2025. While ITC's shares will continue trading on the NSE and BSE, the CSE, one of India's oldest exchanges, is exiting the business after regulatory issues. This move follows ITC's board approval earlier in October.

items.title: 19 private banks can now offer Capital Gains Account scheme
items.summary: The reforms also recognise UPI, IMPS, NEFT, credit cards and other digital modes as valid payment instruments and clarify the effective date of cheque or e-payment deposits.

items.title: DoCA receives self declarations from 25 e-commerce firms on removing deceptive online design
items.summary: The Ministry said this is part of India’s efforts to curb deceptive online design practices that mislead or manipulate consumers. It marks a strong commitment towards consumer transparency and ethical digital ecosystems

items.title: Hike import duty on aluminium to 15%: Mineral industries body
items.summary: In its recommendations for the 2026-27 budget, FIMI seeks urgent policy interventions to protect the domestic aluminium industry

items.title: Japanese bonds draw strong foreign inflows before fiscal jitters hit markets
items.summary: Foreign investors bought Japanese bonds in large numbers, seeking higher returns. However, concerns over the government's stimulus plan later soured sentiment. Japanese stocks also saw significant foreign investment, boosted by positive news from Nvidia. Meanwhile, Japanese investors increased their holdings of foreign stocks and debt.

items.title: Wedding matchmaker Shaadi.com looks to go public in India's sizzling IPO market
items.summary: People Interactive India Pvt., operator of the popular local marriage matchmaking service Shaadi.com, is preparing for an initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter.

items.title: US tariff rollbacks open door for India in agricultural trade
items.summary: India and Brazil as strong candidates for near-term tariff reductions by the US, says Oxford Economics

items.title: Pajson Agro India receives in-principle approval from BSE to raise funds via IPO
items.summary: Pajson Agro India has secured in-principle approval from BSE for its SME IPO, aiming to raise Rs 57 crore through a fresh issue of over 63 lakh shares. Funds will establish a new cashew processing facility in Andhra Pradesh and support general corporate needs. The company, which supplies to major retailers, reported strong FY25 financials.

items.title: Multibagger FMCG stock GRM Overseas hits 42-month high as rally extends to third day; up 140% YTD
items.summary: GRM Overseas, a small-cap stock in the agricultural sector, has seen a 2% increase to  ₹503, marking its highest since May 2022. The stock has gained 340% since March 2024, driven by strong quarterly results and a bonus shares announcement, making it a significant wealth creator in 2025.

items.title: False reading: Peter Cardillo warns the US economy may be weaker than data shows
items.summary: Peter Cardillo of Spartan Capital warns that US economic strength is a “false reading,” with wealthy households masking weak consumer spending and rising layoffs. With the Fed sharply divided on a December rate cut and AI-driven volatility pressuring markets, Cardillo says upcoming macro data could force a policy reversal. Bond yields and a strong dollar currently signal no cut.

items.title: Why India's IPO market is seeing a dramatic last-minute bidding frenzy
items.summary: Between 65% and 80% of all applications now pour in on the final day of the bidding window, shows a Mint analysis of IPO subscription trends since 2022.

items.title: Rs 8,600 crore wipeout! PhysicsWallah shares crash 19% from day 1 peak
items.summary: PhysicsWallah’s early rally has unwound quickly, with the stock extending losses for a second straight session and its market value dropping from nearly Rs 46,300 crore on listing day to below Rs 37,700 crore. Analysts say the company’s strong brand and hybrid learning model support its long-term outlook but warn that competition, regulatory risks and profitability pressures could drive further volatility.

items.title: 12 stocks down over 50% from their yearly high; are you holding any?
items.summary: Despite an 11% surge in Nifty50 and 9% in Nifty500 over the past year, 12 Nifty500 stocks have fallen more than 50% from their yearly highs, highlighting uneven gains in the rally.

items.title: Froth in smallcaps has cooled, opportunity improved: Viraj Gandhi, SAMCO MF CEO
items.summary: Despite recent volatility, the long-term outlook for Indian small-caps remains strong, according to Viraj Gandhi, CEO of SAMCO Mutual Fund. He emphasises the launch of SAMCO’s momentum-based small-cap fund as an opportunity for long-term investors amidst a reset in valuations.

items.title: Sammaan Capital shares jump 9% from day’s low as firm issues clarification on CBI probe
items.summary: Sammaan Capital shares rebounded sharply on Thursday after the company clarified that no investigative or regulatory agency has any ongoing probe related to allegations in a 2019 PIL filed by a whistleblower forum. The Supreme Court also noted that no affidavit indicated wrongdoing by the firm, helping the stock recover following Tuesday’s sharp decline.

items.title: India needs a digital sovereignty check: Thankfully, our infrastructure stack has given us a headstart
items.summary: A global shift is underway as nations scramble to control their digital foundations. As countries turn inward and old certainties fade, we must invest in population-scale systems to keep the country running even if the world decides to pull the plug. Our digital stack was prescient. Build on it.

items.title: ED attaches fresh assets worth over ₹1,400 cr in case against Anil Ambani's Reliance Group
items.summary: The latest provisional attachment order has been issued under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act for assets located in various parts of the country

items.title: ED attaches fresh assets worth over ₹1,400 crore in case against Anil Ambani's Reliance Group
items.summary: The federal investigative agency had earlier attached properties worth ₹7,500 crore in this case

items.title: Bitcoin drops nearly 30% from its yearly peak, market cap wipes out $1 trillion in recent weeks
items.summary: Bitcoin has dropped nearly 30% from its yearly high above $126,000, driving a crypto market slump that has erased over $1 trillion in value. On Thursday, it traded at $92,783. Over the past 24 hours, Bitcoin rose about 2%, while Ethereum slipped 0.41% to $3,051. Most major altcoins declined up to 2%, though Solana and Hyperliquid gained more than 3%.

items.title: Why beauty brands in India are rushing into premium and prestige skincare
items.summary: Facing fierce competition, rising customer acquisition costs, and product similarities in the mass market, Indian beauty brands are launching ultra-premium or prestige lines.

items.title: Anurag Singh says AI rally overheated but far from a dotcom-style bubble
items.summary: Market expert Anurag Singh argues the AI boom isn't a dotcom-era bubble, citing established tech giants funding investments from profits. While valuations may be stretched, he believes corrections, not bubbles, are likely, even for companies like Nvidia, due to a lack of alternatives and strong revenue streams.

items.title: ACME Solar Holdings commissions additional 16MW of Gujarat wind power project
items.summary: ACME Solar Holdings has commissioned an additional 16 MW of its wind power project in Surendaranagar, Gujarat. This brings the project's operational capacity to 44 MW. The company's total operational capacity now stands at 2,934 MW. The project, financed by PFC, will sell power under a 25-year PPA. Officials confirmed the commissioning.

items.title: Mumbai-based Provogue India duped of ₹90 crore; ex-director among four booked
items.summary: Provogue India manufactures and sells a wide range of products, including men’s and women’s apparel, accessories and luggage

items.title: Mint Explainer | How InvITs are changing the way India builds highways
items.summary: India’s highway programme requires massive capital. But with the National Highways Authority of India’s high debt load and government budget support reaching its limits, the Centre is turning to a new financial vehicle: infrastructure investment trusts (InvITs).&nbsp;

items.title: Starbucks, Tata announce Farmer Support Partnership to help 10,000 Indian coffee growers by 2030
items.summary: To share global agronomy expertise, develop climate resilience and donate 1 million high yielding Arabica seedlings over next 5 years

items.title: India eyes chip parity with US, China by 2032 as $10 bn semiconductor push gains momentum
items.summary: India’s ambitions come as global chip leaders — from Taiwan and South Korea to the US, China and Japan — pour hundreds of billions of dollars into expanding their own capacities to secure supply for future technologies such as AI, electric mobility and advanced computing. Vaishnaw argued that India’s strengths go beyond capital investment and include engineering talent and maturing design depth.

items.title: Southern Railway to launch India’s first coast-to-coast parcel express train between Royapuram (Chennai) and Mangaluru Central
items.summary: The timetabled logistics service connecting key business hubs of Tamil Nadu and Kerala will commence on December 12 from Mangaluru

items.title: India bonds inch lower on caution ahead of debt supply
items.summary: Indian government bonds saw a slight dip as investors held back before Friday's significant debt auction. Uncertainty surrounding the Reserve Bank of India's future rate cuts and liquidity plans is driving caution.

items.title: AI doomsday? Not yet. Why Nvidia results are dragging the tech bulls back to work
items.summary: Nvidia’s blockbuster earnings shattered fears of an AI slowdown, delivering a record revenue beat and reigniting a global tech rally. Surging demand for Blackwell GPUs, strong guidance, and accelerating data-center growth helped silence AI doomsday narratives. Markets across Asia rallied sharply as investors regained confidence that the AI boom is far from losing momentum.

items.title: Groww shares extend slide for second session as market awaits Q2 earnings tomorrow
items.summary: The stock closed 7.84 per cent lower on the BSE at ₹156.62. Q2 results set to be announced tomorrow.

items.title: What are the likely trends that can trigger a rally in the market?
items.summary: India's stock market has underperformed global peers due to stretched valuations and a dip in earnings growth. However, a consumption boom fueled by fiscal stimulus and rate cuts is expected to drive earnings recovery from Q3 FY26, potentially triggering a market rally. Global trends, especially US developments, will also play a crucial role.

items.title: 5 listed Indian REITs distribute over Rs 2,331 crore to unitholders in Q2 FY26
items.summary: India's five publicly listed REITs distributed over Rs 2,331 crore to unitholders in Q2 FY26, managing assets worth Rs 2.35 lakh crore. The sector's market capitalization surpassed Rs 1.6 lakh crore, highlighting investor confidence and the growing maturity of this asset class in India's capital markets.

items.title: Sudeep Pharma IPO to open tomorrow; GMP rises 22%. Should you apply?
items.summary: Sudeep Pharma IPO: Shares are seeing solid momentum in the grey market, trading at a 21.92% premium to the issue price of ₹593. At this GMP, the stock is expected to list near ₹723, signalling a potential upside of about ₹130 per share.

items.title: AMD, Cisco, and Saudi's Humain launch AI joint venture, land first major customer
items.summary: Advanced Micro Devices, Cisco Systems and Saudi Arabian artificial intelligence startup Humain are forming a joint venture to build data centres in the Middle East

items.title: IPO boom: 5 pillars for India’s stock market to become Asia’s listing hub
items.summary: India is poised to become Asia's premier listing hub, building on its IPO boom and strong domestic investor base. By refining key pillars like institutional capital, research, governance, listing processes, and valuation frameworks, the nation can attract global companies and solidify its position as a leading financial center.

items.title: Anil Ambani’s Reliance Power shares rise 5%, snap 3-day fall. What’s behind the surge?
items.summary: Reliance Power shares rose sharply after the company announced a major governance overhaul and key clean-energy milestones. The board approved a new Board of Management to strengthen oversight, while subsidiary Reliance NU Energies secured 4 GW solar and 6.5 GW BESS capacity.

items.title: Swiggy back to square one as stock sinks 36% from peak, returns to IPO price. What's ahead?
items.summary: Swiggy's stock has fallen 36% from its peak, returning nearly to its IPO price of Rs 390. Despite a 54% revenue jump, the company's net loss widened to Rs 1,092 crore in Q2FY26, primarily due to quick commerce expansion. Brokerages remain divided on its future prospects.

items.title: Parent circulation forms ahead of ‘low’ over Bay
items.summary: Massive cloud build-up over south-east Bay of Bengal ahead of formation of next low-pressure area

items.title: Stock markets rally in early trade tracking firm global peers, fresh foreign fund inflows
items.summary: Sensex climbed to hit its 52-week high of 85,470.96 and Nifty went up to 26,136

items.title: Fujiyama Power Systems slumps on debut, closes 9% below IPO price
items.summary: Muted listing reflected cautious market sentiment even as the broader indices remained stable

items.title: Reliance Power board takes step for stronger governance
items.summary: The company also highlighted the emerging growth opportunities within its subsidiary, Reliance NU Energies

items.title: NCLT greenlights SeQuent Scientific - Viyash Lifesciences merger
items.summary: The genericisation of animal health provides a substantial opportunity for the combined company to leverage its technical strengths in APIs and formulations

items.title: Trump’s economy depends on AI for growth, a reality made clear in Saudi crown prince’s U.S. visit
items.summary: U.S. President Donald Trump is counting on the tech sector and artificial intelligence to drive his economic agenda

items.title: Wedding matchmaker Shaadi.com said to be considering IPO
items.summary: The Mumbai-based firm is said to have held talks with investment bankers to explore a listing

items.title: PSU Banks steal the spotlight as private lenders lose steam: Sunil Subramaniam
items.summary: Private sector banks are struggling to keep pace with market value, as their valuations are already high, leaving little room for error. In contrast, public sector banks are benefiting from reforms, potential capital limit increases, and consolidation, positioning them well for the upcoming private capex cycle.

items.title: QT ends sooner than expected as Fed prioritizes market calm
items.summary: The Federal Reserve has halted quantitative tightening earlier than expected, aiming to stabilise liquidity rather than shrink the balance sheet further. Policymakers remain divided over the long-term implications of maintaining an expanded balance-sheet footprint.

items.title: JP Power shares rally nearly 30% in two days after Adani Group wins creditor nod for JP Associates acquisition
items.summary: JP Power News: Jaiprakash Power Ventures surged nearly 30% in two sessions after the Adani Group secured Committee of Creditors approval to acquire Jaiprakash Associates. The $1.5-billion deal marks a major step in the Jaypee Group’s insolvency process. Adani Enterprises received a Letter of Intent (LoI) from the Resolution Professional on November 19, 2025.

items.title: Sensex, Nifty edge higher on positive global cues; bank Nifty hits fresh all-time high
items.summary: Global markets ended in the green on Wednesday, led by a rebound in technology shares after Nvidia’s strong earnings guidance

items.title: No growth trigger ahead: Sandip Agarwal flags valuation risks in IT
items.summary: Despite a recent Nifty IT index surge, a market expert warns the rally lacks fundamental support, citing declining effort-based billing as a core concern. Valuations appear stretched, with limited triggers for significant growth expected in the coming quarters.  While Q2 earnings met low expectations, future volume growth and margin expansion are unlikely to justify current high multiples.

items.title: Crude oil futures gain as official data show US inventory decline
items.summary: At 9.58 am on Thursday, January Brent oil futures were at $63.68, up by 0.25%, and January crude oil futures on WTI were at $59.43, up by 0.30%

items.title: Nvidia’s AI Tipping Point: Boom or Bubble?
items.summary: Nvidia’s strong performance and bullish long-term AI vision boost confidence, but analysts caution that heavy customer reliance, infrastructure constraints, and rising competition pose significant risks.

items.title: India seeks tankers for West Asia oil after Russia sanctions
items.summary: Roughly a dozen vessels have been chartered so far this week to ship crude from countries including Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, Iraq and the United Arab Emirates and ferry it across the Arabian Sea

items.title: Fujiyama Power Systems shares make weak debut, list at 4% discount to IPO price
items.summary: Fujiyama Power Systems shares debuted on Dalal Street with a discount. The solar solutions company's IPO saw moderate interest. Fujiyama manufactures and sells a wide range of rooftop solar products. The company has a strong distribution network. Financials show robust growth. Analysts believe the issue is fully priced. Much will depend on market conditions.

items.title: Oil edges up as US peace push may add to oversupply, though stockpile pull lends support
items.summary: Oil prices edged higher on Thursday after yesterday's minor dip. The market is navigating through uncertainty as optimistic forecasts of supply increases from a possible resolution to the Russia-Ukraine conflict clash with a notable decrease in U.S. crude stockpiles. Meanwhile, the demand for U.S. crude is being fueled by active refining and strong export figures.

items.title: IMAX bets on India’s ‘multiplier effect’ as market enters high-growth phase
items.summary: IMAX anticipates a high-growth phase in India over the next two to three years, driven by a larger slate and expanded national footprint. The company has seen a significant increase in its footprint and a 78% year-to-date box office growth in local currency, highlighting strong audience appetite for premium moviegoing experiences.

items.title: Rupee falls 18 paise to 88.66 against US dollar in early trade
India's amazing stock market performance has something to say about us
items.summary: Our stock market is soaring on sentiment, scarcity of alternatives and the sugar rush of valuation highs—rather than on earnings or economic logic. This fever mirrors our own oddities. We want prosperity without patience and convenience without consequence. Can the market give us that?

items.title: Rupee falls 18 paise to 88.66 against U.S. dollar in early trade
items.summary: Brent crude, the global oil benchmark, was trading 0.28% higher at $63.69 per barrel in futures trade

items.title: India poised to outperform globally over next 12-15 months, says Trideep Bhattacharya
items.summary: Edelweiss AMC CIO Trideep Bhattacharya says India’s markets are entering a fresh earnings upcycle after the first upgrades in over a year, with valuations now far more reasonable. Consumer discretionary, financials and select IT names are turning stronger, while easing global trade headwinds and potential India-US deal momentum could drive markets higher over the next 12–15 months.

items.title: Meta chief AI scientist Yann LeCun leaving for startup
items.summary: "As many of you have heard through rumors or recent media articles, I am planning to leave Meta after 12 years," LeCun said on his Facebook

items.title: Barclays lifts S&P 500 target to 7,400 on megacap tech strength
items.summary: Japan’s Nikkei index surged 4% on Thursday, fueled by Nvidia’s strong earnings and exceptionally high demand for its AI chips, lifting market sentiment.

items.title: Fast&Up in talks to raise $50-70 million in new round, appoints banker
items.summary: Sports-nutrition brand Fast&amp;Up is in talks to raise $50–70 mn to expand manufacturing, enter new categories and widen distribution amid rising competition in India’s wellness market.

items.title: The forgotten Tata stock: Will investors ever recover Rs 25,000 crore loss that keeps getting bigger?
items.summary: Tata Technologies, once a dream listing, has seen its market value plummet by Rs 25,000 crore from its peak.  Revenue concentration on Tata Motors and JLR, coupled with their challenges, has led to uneven financial performance and cautious brokerage sentiment. items.summary: But along with that the employment growth rates have started to dip, NV 'Tiger' Tyagarajan says. The percentage addition of employees in India will not be same as past. And due to advancements, a workforce with higher skill sets is required for the IT industry, he says.

items.title: Pixel launch: Is Google Assistant's AI an assault on privacy?
items.summary: Sure, artificial intelligence can make life simpler by suggesting you places to eat, tell you weather, or even crack a joke.  The more you use it, the more it learns about your habits and preferences. The protocols pertaining to artificial intelligence, or the lack of it, make our data less secure and more vulnerable.

items.title: Up over 200% in 1 year, what's buzzing with Borosil Glass?
items.summary: Shares of Borosil Glass Works have increased threefold over the past one year as the company has posted strong revenue and EBIDTA growth over the past few quarters.

items.title: Why you should not be always chasing returns
items.summary: Most people focus on returns and chase products that offer the best returns at any point.

items.title: Jhunjhunwala-partnered fund buys stake in TFCI: What's buzzing?
items.summary: In an interview with CNBC-TV18, Satpal Arora, MD of Tourism Finance Corporation of India (TFCI), talked about the state of business and the outlook ahead.

items.title: RBI latest meeting 'diluted' its old policy framework: Nomura
items.summary: On Tuesday, the central bank surprised the market with a 25-basis-point cut to its policy repo rate, or the rate at which it lends to banks, to 6.25 percent.

items.title: Bond bull market may pause but is far from over: Expert
items.summary: The benchmark 10-year government-security yield remained stuck in 8-7.5 percent range through all of 2015 and half of 2016, moving lower to sub-7 percent only when the RBI promised in April to reduce the system's liquidity deficit. The yield may now fall more.

items.title: Scope for meaningful rate cuts going ahead: Neelkanth Mishra
items.summary: Credit Suisse' Neelkanth Mishra expects repo rate to fall to a decade low in the coming quarters. He says that beginning December the market may see a robust and widespread pick-up which may boost indices.

items.title: Tech up to a healthier world
items.summary: Sensors, 3D printed skin, wearables, reconstructed organs, revolutionized clinical trials, personalized medicine and what not – get ready for a new era of healthcare

items.title: Steel stocks rally as govt extends MIP on 66 steel products
items.summary: Stocks like Hindustan Zinc, Hindalco, Jindal Steel, JSW Steel and Tata Steel gained over 1 percent from previous close.

items.title: Endurance Technologies IPO opens: Should you subscribe?
items.summary: The Aurangabad-based company aims to mop up nearly Rs 1,162 crore (at higher end of price band) by diluting 17.5 percent stake through the issue that will close on October 7. It already raised Rs 348.52 crore through anchor investors' portion on Tuesday, the day before issue opening.

items.title: Cautiously optimistic on India; eyeing earnings revival: Sanger
items.summary: Global liquidity tailwinds are unlikely to get any better from now and that makes Arvind Sanger, Managing Partner at Geosphere Capital Management “cautiously optimistic” on the Indian markets.

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.
